name: Palace Road Hotel Prague

reviews.text: This is a wonderful set of rooms in several buildings in the Castle area of Prague. Their website will show you every room, so it's great that you can see exactly what you'll get. I believe I had the Marigold Room (it's been a year, sorry it took so long to write), which was very spacious, with floor to ceiling windows opening to a small patio, nice antique furniture, a modern kitchen. I shared a bath with one other room, just outside the door. At a very reasonable price for Prague. I'd say the only drawback is that you have to walk a couple blocks to another one of their buildings for the breakfast. I would definitely book there again.
reviews.title: really nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Middle Embassy Room which was very large with a very comfortable bed (two twin beds made into a king). For the price, this room could not be beat. We paid $113 USD per night (mailed in check beforehand). The bathroom, shared with another room, was rather grim, but there was a washing machine with detergent provided that we put to good use. Great location for the sights. on a relatively quiet street at night, The breakfast was about a 10 minute walk uphill away, but it was worth the hike (on the way up to the castle). Good selection of breads, cheese, and cereals and some fruit plus there were 4 high-speed internet Dell computer to use for free. I would recommend the Castle steps for those who do not require absolute cleanliness.
reviews.title: Great location, comfy bed, good breakfast and free internet

reviews.text: This was our first visit to Prague and we stayed in a studio at the castle steps. The room was tiny and clean and had a little window. The bathroom was spacious. In my opinion, the studio can do with some cosmetics. It was at the top of the building (about 74 steps...phew!). The location is great ..central and quiet. The staff are very helpful. There is free breakfast in the cellar (loved the bread) and free internet :)
reviews.title: Good value for money

likes.liked: — Great location and friendliness of staff
likes.disliked: — Studio could do with some cosmetics

reviews.text: This holiday we stayed in what was called the Beech Apartment, which was super. We had two rooms which provided much more space than we needed. There was a mixture of antiques including a big wardrobe and chest of drawers plus a couple of painted trunks. We also had a big television which got a lot of satellite channels although not the Discovery Channel, unfortunately.
reviews.title: Spacious and comfortable

reviews.text: When we arrived it was late and I was a little worried at first that we weren't in the centre. However the next day I saw that the castle was just down the road. This is really a good spot, because the air is much cleaner than on the other side of the river.
reviews.title: Even better 2nd time around

reviews.text: We stayed in a very nice apartment that was much nicer than anticipated. We arranged to be picked up at the airport and the driver that brought us was very friendly. We were then taken to the hotel where a young gentleman met us and took us to our apartment. It didn't seem like a hotel at first as we were met utside our building but we soon discovered it offered all the services of a hotel i.e. a thorough daily clean, restocking of towels, breakfast and so on. We also arranged a tour through the hotel. There was a mix up with the pick up for the tour but it was sooned rectified by reception. We talked to some other guests at breakfast and they agreed with us that this is a definite must.
reviews.title: Very well organized

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my boyfriend were originally booked in to the Cypress Room but when we arrived at reception we were told that we were staying in the Beech Apartment. I was worried that there was a mix up or something but we were actually told by the staff when they took us to our room that it was a free upgrade. It was worth it. We ended up with an apartment - far too big for just the two of us - looking over a huge park.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for the hotel, the staff were more than friendly, we used our holiday as an apartment stay and didn't require the hotel much but we met the staff at breakfast every morning to say 'hi'.
reviews.title: Very mixed review

likes.disliked: — sharing a bathroom with 3 drunken strangers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The door to the building we stayed in was a huge old wooden door and was proving difficult at times but the building was beautiful and away from the hustle and bustle of the new town in Prague,
reviews.title: Huge room

reviews.text: Well worth it
reviews.title: Very well organised, lovely room
Another great trip to Prague
reviews.text: Fourth trip to Prague and once again we stayed with Castle Steps, but in a different building this time. We had originally booked Hazel studio but were upgraded to the adjacent suite, Lilac. The rooms were extremely spacious with a huge shared terrace looking out towards Petrin - really nice to sit out with a drink at the end of the day.

As always with the Castle Steps, the place was spotlessly clean. One small criticism concerns the kitchen equipment or rather the lack of it - we had no intention of catering for ourselves beyond the odd drink or snack but - no ice cube tray, no bottle opener, no corkscrew, coffee filter papers but no filter. An inch of water in the bottom of a glass in the freezer provided alternative cooling for the G & T though so all was not lost!
reviews.title: What is to like?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We normally use public transport between the airport and Mala Strana but this time the flight was due in at 10.00pm so we booked the taxi transfer offered by Castle Steps. Our arrival was delayed by about 4 hours (courtesy of BMI Baby) but the taxi driver was waiting for us and whisked us to the apartment - excellent service.
reviews.title: Ideal for the city

reviews.text: All in all another good trip to Prague.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay, beautiful view and excellent service!

reviews.text: I can't figure out why anyone would want to stay here! The location is great, but everything else is subpar.
reviews.title: More than expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a few places over the New Year in our jaunt around Central Europe and this was one of our favourites. We had seem some very nice hotels but many were faceless (i.e. 6 floors, hundreds of rooms). The Castle Steps was much more low-key but still seemed organised, very clean and very friendly staff with a personal servicetouch. We made a suggestion that a caffetiere would have been a nice touch and, low and behold, one was provided for us.
reviews.title: Great location and staff

likes.liked: — location - accessible to everything you need to see in prague in a short time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the location of our apartment near charles bridge. and we went home impressed with the furnishings and the availability of free internet. It may be a suggestion to have recycling bins or bags or something to go with the eco-friendly products that the hotel endorsed.
reviews.title: Character room in great location

reviews.text: We arrived at the Castle Steps on the 20th of December for a 2 night stay. The Pine Apartment has a lot of character although the tiny bathroom may be a problem for some given the sloping ceiling and not being able to stand whilst having a shower!
reviews.title: Good view but not very well with the location

reviews.text: The location was great as it took less than 10 minutes to stroll down to Charles Bridge and about the same to make our way up to the Castle.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay, Wonderful Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was ok although there was not much choice - bagels and/or bread, and cereals. There were slices of peppers etc. but we didn't really fancy these for breakfast - it would have been better to have a variety of fruits and skimmed/semi-skimmed milk and butter rather than soya milk and butter.
reviews.title: Great location, Good Value

description: Our small boutique hotel is located in the heart of the historical center of the Prague in Mala Strana (Lesser Town), in a building which is declared as cultural monument of the Czech Republic. The interior is furnished with Czech antic pieces and decorated with antic oil paintings. It is a perfect place for travelers who are looking after different experience then a classic hotel accommodation.Either you are on romantic city escape, budget trip, or you would like to spend couple of days exploring Prague with your friends and family, we have the right accommodation for you! You can choose among luxurious deluxe double rooms with Jacuzzi or a suite with a balcony, family apartment with fully equipped kitchen to cozy attic double rooms or spacious rooms with shared bathroom.Our professional team will be always there for you to help and share tips about what you can do and see in the town.
